bill.title: An Act Relating To Miscellaneous Changes To Election Laws And To Lobbyist Reporting
bill.description: An Act Relating To Miscellaneous Changes To Election Laws And To Lobbyist Reporting

history.action: Read 1st time & referred to Committee on Government Operations
Entered on Notice Calendar
Favorable report with recommendation of amendment by Committee onGovernment Operations
New Business/Second Reading
Favorable report with recommendation of amendment by Committee on Government Operations
Read second time, reported favorably with recommendation of amendment by Senator White for Committee on Government Operations
Senator(s) Snelling motion to amend recommendation of amendment; text
Motion to amend agreed to on a roll call, requested by Senator Sears, Passed -- Needed 15 of 29 to Pass -- Yeas = 29, Nays = 0
Recommendation of amendment by Committee on Government Operations, as amended, agreed to
3rd reading ordered
New Business/Third Reading
Pending third reading, Senator(s) Ayer, French, McAllister, Pollina, and White moved to amend bill
Motion to amend bill agreed to
Pending third reading, Senator(s) Galbraith moved to amend bill
Senator Galbraith requested & granted leave to withdraw amendment
Pending third reading, Senator(s) Galbraith moved to amend bill
Motion to amend bill agreed to
Pending third reading, motion to amend bill offered by Senator(s) Zuckerman
Motion to amend bill agreed to
Read 3rd time & passed
Read First Time and Referred to the Committee on Government Operations
Rep. Martin of Wolcott moved to postpone action until Thursday April 3, 2014. which was agreed to
Read Second Time
Report of Committee on Government Operations withdrawn

Rep. Martin of Wolcott, Cole of Burlington, Consejo of Sheldon, Devereux of Mount Holly, Evans of Essex, Higley of Lowell, Hubert of Milton, Lewis of Berlin, Mook of Bennington, Sweaney of Windsor, and Townsend of South Burlington moved to amend the bill
Rep. Martin of Wolcott moved that the House propose to the Senate to amend the bill which was agreed to
Third Reading Ordered
Read Third time
Passed in Concurrence with Proposal of Amendment
House message House passed bill in concurrence with proposal(s) of amendment
House Proposal of Amendment
New Business/House Proposal of Amendment
House proposal of amendment; text
House proposal of amendment not concurred in; Committee of Conference requested, on motion of Senator White
Committee of Conference appointed: Senators White, McAllister, and French
Senate Message, House proposal of amendment not concurred in and committee of conference appointed
Speaker appointed Martin of Wolcott, Hubert of Milton and Consejo of Sheldon as members of the Committee of Conference on the part of the House
House message House appointed Conference Committee members
Committee of Conference report agreed to (Senate bill)
Rules suspended and bill messaged forthwith to the Senate as moved by Rep. Turner of Milton
House message House adopted Conference Committee report
Committee of Conference Report
New Business/Committee of Conference Report
Committee of Conference Report
Committee of Conference report submitted by Senator White for Committee, text
Committee of Conference report adopted
As passed by Senate and House
Senate Message, Passed in Concurrence
Delivered to Governor on May 22, 2014
Signed by Governor on May 28, 2014
Senate Message, Signed by Governor May 28, 2014

votes.desc: Shall sections 5, 6 and 8 of the recommendation of amendment of the Committee on Government Operations be stricken?
Shall recommendation of amendment of the Committee on Government Operations be amended by striking out Secs. 5, 6 and 8, as moved by Senator Snelling?
